Vishal Dhakad, who is from the OBC community, speaks with great excitement when asked about the elections. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½All votes are going to Chandrabhan. Uska vyavahar hai logon se (He talks to people). You should have seen him going to file his nomination. More than 15,000 people turned up without being asked to. Go to his office and he will meet you with so much affection and respect. Ask him to get anything done and he immediately acts,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he says.
Mukul Saxena, a retired government servant in town, however, says he will continue to vote for the BJP. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The vote is for Modi. Gehlot is wearing a skull cap in public functions. If Hindus do not unite, we will be finished,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he adds.
In the constituencyï¿½s ill vote for them again,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ says Rameshlal, a Bhil f

Title: Ashok Gehlot: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½BJP is contesting Rajasthan LS styleï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ poora dhawa bo
Text:
Aiming to buck the three-decade trend of alternating governments and hoping for his fourth term, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot, 72, is leading the Congress partyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s electioneering for the November 25 Assembly polls as it faces a formidable challenge from the Opposition BJP whose campaign is being spearheaded by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Facing ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½anti-incumbencyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, the Congress MLAs are banking on Gehlotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s welfare measures ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ and his face ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ to help them sail through, even as the CM has appealed to voters to see these elections as if he is contesting it on all 200 seats himself.
About 30 hours before the curtains come down on campaigning in the state and just before setting out to give one final push through another round of his whirlwind tours, Gehlot sits down at his residence in Jaipur for an interview with The Indian Express. Excerpts:
Advertisemime will tell). In 1998, we won 156 seats when I was the PCC president. And now we have given a spectacular performance in Rajasthan, be it corona management, passing laws, and giving schemes or guarantees. An atmosphere of good governance has been created, so I said, ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Mission 156ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, and we are moving more and more towards it. Where we will stop, I canï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t say.
There are many beneficiaries of various schemes but there is also uncertainty over the creation of a ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½beneficiary classï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½.
We are the one who give benefits. What the person taking the benefit thinks is up to him. We have left no stone unturned when it comes to performance. We have given a shandaar (excellent) performance and people are convinced of it. It is being discussed in villages and our schemes and benefits are reaching homes.
But the Rajasthan governmentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s debt to GSDP ratio has gone up to arounwe are able to take loan on the basis of our performance and as per the set criteria. In terms of rate of our economic growth, which is 11.04%, we are first in North India and second among all the big states in the country, after Andhra Pradesh, where it is 11.4%.
Also Read | Decoding Politics: 5 reasons why BJP is gunning for Ashok Gehlot govt over crimes against women
When there was the BJP government in 2017, we were 30th in the country when it came to the per capita income. Today, we are 12th ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ that has been our achievement as Rajasthanï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s per capita income has increased by 46.48%. And our dream is to become the first by 2030.
Advertisement
Then in 2020-21, our state GDP growth rate was 19.50%, the highest in a decade. In 2022, our food-grain production rate was double the national average at 8.10%. In the manufacturing sector, we were 12th during the BJP rule, now we are 7th. Due to people-friendly tax reforms, there was 24% increase in 2021-22 in revenuo share the benefits of a growing economy with the people.
BJP has no CM face this time around. Do you think it is benefiting the Congress?
It naturally helps. It is a Vidhan Sabha election, but you (BJP) are contesting it in Lok Sabha style. Central leaders are coming, there is PM Modi, Amit Shah ji, five Chief Ministers have come, 5-7 Union Ministers. Toh poora dhawa bol rakha hai Rajasthan pe (They have launched a full-scale offensive in Rajasthan) as they could not topple our government. So when they could not topple the government here while managing to topple governments in Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and played foul in Goa and Manipur, toh sarkaar nahi girane ka dard chhipa hua hai inke dil ke andar (so the pain of not being able to topple the government is in their hearts) which keeps coming out time and again. Woh is liye dhawa bolte hain (Hence theyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ve launched an offensive) on me, my family, PCC president and his family, and the government.
Ask them, is there achemes? It is a state election and we worked for five years, so tell us our shortcomings. I challenge them to debate us on it.
Advertisement
In the last six months there have been raids on 51 locations by CBI, Income Tax, ED. Ask them, have you been able to pinpoint any politician or a bureaucrat (in connection with any case)?
You had said that the Congress will announce candidates two months in advance but there was a delay, and even then most sitting MLAs were repeated despite anti-incumbency. Why?
Option nahi hota (there is no option). First, the work is done for five years through MLAs, including in Panchayati Raj and Nagar Palika. And when the (local party) unit is set up, it is done through them. When everything is done through them, so naturally by the time elections come, woh he sab kuch hota hai wahan par (MLA becomes everything there). Although, this shouldnï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t be the case. Ideally, (party) organisation should do organisation work and MLA should do MLA work. But unfortunatelMLA increases in every political party. This time (in next government) we will try that MLA does MLA work and organisation does organisation work, this will be my thinking.
Apparently, there is unity between you and Sachin Pilot, but on the ground there still seems to be a lot of disagreement between your supporters.
I canï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t say what kind of situation is in a particular area. But by and large we are trying to go into the campaign united.
Who will be the CM if the Congress returns to power?
I have said it many times that we have had a good tradition in the party ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ we pass a single line proposal. And high command also considers what the MLAs feel, what the common man thinks, and decides.
Priyanka Gandhi has been asking voters here not to be swayed by emotive issues while PM Modi accuses your government of ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½appeasement politicsï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ and keeps mentioning Kanhaiya Lalï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s murder.
They donï¿½ldnï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t. The kind of language Prime Minister is using, ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½press the button as if you are hanging (Congress)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½. Ye kaunsi language hui (What kind of language is this)?
Advertisement
And Yogi ji (Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath) too employs such language for (conveying) other points. So the change in their language is a sign of their frustration. When you are staring at a loss, you are not as careful (with your words).
Why did Rahul Gandhi arrive so late for the Rajasthan campaign? He even went to Telangana before Rajasthan, though it votes after Rajasthan.
Mere pe vishwas tha unko (Rahul trusted me).
Advertisement
The BJP has made law and order an issue, especially crimes against women, while the Congress says that the numbers have increased mainly due to the mandatory registration of FIRs. Could this have been communicated better to the public?
The NCRB (National Crime Records Bureau) figures are brought by the Central government and if t becomes even better. Incidents happen in every state but the immediate action, which happens here doesnï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t happen anywhere else.
What is happening in UP? There is no rule of law. Rajasthan not only has a rule of law but the compulsory FIR has had a huge impact. The court ordered cases through CrPC section 156 (3) are not even around 10% now as FIRs are being lodged now. This is a living example before us.
Advertisement
How much do you think the smaller parties would damage the prospects of the Congress candidates, especially in seats where the contest may go down to the wire?
See if our schemes, guarantees and laws have reached the homes then they (smaller parties) wonï¿½ï¿½

Title: Who is Sourav Ganguly batting for now? Kolkata back to an old game
Text:
AS BATSMAN, skipper, BCCI president or commentator, Sourav Ganguly thrived on unfriendly pitches. The presumed Prince of Kolkataï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s presumptive political project, however, is taking longer to find its feet ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ with the latest development putting him in Team Trinamool Congress.
On Tuesday, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee named Ganguly as the stateï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Brand Ambassador, replacing megastar Shah Rukh Khan. The announcement, at the TMC governmentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Global Business Summit gala, came two months after Ganguly accompanied the CM on a rare foreign visit by her, as a precursor to the summit and to draw investment to Bengal.
And it came just over a year after a reluctant Ganguly was replaced as BCCI president with Roger Binny, in an organisation where the shots are seen as called by Secretary Jay Shah, the son of Union Home Minister Amit Shah.
Advertisement
Go further back, to before the 2021 Assembly polls, and ýs high-decibel campaign had talked up the partyýýýs chances in the elections, though these were swept by the TMC eventually.
The rumours of Gangulyýýýs proximity to the BJP top brass at the time had grown after photographs emerged of him hosting Shah along with senior state BJP leaders Suvendu Adhikari and Sukanta Majumder for a meal at his home.
Also Read | Mamata lays out new projects and policies: from sea cable to biofuel
Days later though, Ganguly was by the side of Mamata at the State Secretariat. In September 2022, he shared the stage with her at a thanksgiving ceremony after Bengal got the UNESCO heritage tag for Durga Puja.
But it was the end of Gangulyýýýs BCCI tenure in October 2022 that was the firmest hint that the bonhomie between the cricketer and BJP may have ended.
Advertisement
After his appointment as Bengal brand ambassador Tuesday, BJP leaders openly speculated that Mamata had made her move for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls by co-opting arguably Bengalýýýs biggest sporting star.
Addressing Ganguly, who was seated on the dais, the CM said at the business summit: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½He is a very popular figure and comes from a younger generation. I want to inform him that he is now the brand ambassador of Bengal. I will request him to accept thisï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ You canï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t say no.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The former India cricket captain had earlier been as full of praise for the CM in his speech at the programme. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I say this genuinely, whenever I send her (Mamata) an SMS, I get a response within a minute. Rarely is there a delay. Whenever she watches me on television, she sends an SMS, asking how I am and whether I have eaten. I am so touched with the care and affection you have shown me,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Ganguly said.
Advertisement
Asked about what he thought of their exchange, BJP national vice-president and former Bengal chief Dilip Ghosh said Wednesday: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½It has taken so long for the BengaMamata) wants to hold Souravï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s handï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ She wants to use him for 2024ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Shah Rukh Khanï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s market is down.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The BJP, in contrast, has always acknowledged Gangulyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s role as an ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½iconï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, Ghosh said. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½He was given the honour of brand ambassador by Tripura (a BJP-ruled state) much beforeï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ The BJP made him BCCI president. The BJP used him in cricket, not politics.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
TMC leader Jay Prakash Majumder told The Indian Express that the BJPï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s reaction again showed that ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½anything concerning the development of Bengal, benefit of Bengal makes the BJP, especially the Bengal BJP, unhappyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The poor are suffering because of the economic blockade by theher the Ganguly-Mamata warmth hinted that he was ready for his long-awaited political plunge, Ghosh said: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½It is for Ganguly to decide whether he will join politics or not.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A senior TMC leader said: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The CPI(M) first tried to rope him in. A few years back, the BJP tried to rope him in. Now, it is a great move by Mamata Banerjee to make him the brand ambassador. Who knows what will happen next? It all depends on Ganguly.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Advertisement
Before the 2021 Assembly polls, he was said to have declined a BJP proposal for direct entry into politics.
After his visit to Spain and the UAE in Spain in September, Ganguly insisted to mediapersons that he has no political affiliations. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I am an individual, I am not an MLA, MP. I donï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t have any political attachment. I get invited across the world, Spain, Kolkata, Delhi. I am not answerable to anybody. We are humans and weeen around for 17 years ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ are hardly likely to die down soon.
Back then, in 2006, when he was two years from retirement and still trying to make a comeback to the national team, Ganguly had denied any plans to campaign for the CPI(M), then the long-running

Title: As Telangana sentiment wanes, other issues bubble up, as do Congress hopes
Text:
The battle for Telangana is winding down to a contest of promises, with just about a week left for polling now. While the ruling Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) led by Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao or KCR is showcasing the state governmentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s welfare schemes, the Congress is projecting a slew of similar schemes it is pledging if voted to power.
Across large swathes of the erstwhile undivided districts of Nalgonda and Mahbubnagar, the Congress appears to have a fresh energy in its ranks.
In the Assembly elections held in 2014 to a united Andhra Pradesh (Telangana was carved out soon after), the then incumbent Congress, despite a pro-BRS (BRS was formerly called Telangana Rashtra Samithi) wave, had got 25.20% of the votes, against the BRSï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s 34% in the Telangana area.
Advertisement
Also in Political Pulse | With Telangana manifesto, Congress tries to outdo BRS sop for sop
In 2018 (when the elections were brought forward by the BRS government), both parties had for the BRS. In terms of seats, it worked out to 63 and 88 seats out of 119 for the BRS, and 21 and 19 seats for the Congress, in 2014 and 2018 respectively.
The rise in BRS votes was attributed to the pro-Telangana state sentiment, as the party was widely perceived to be one of its key architects.
But that sentiment seems to have waned now. Very few people talk about the sacrifices that people, especially youth, made for the cause of Telangana statehood. Their concerns have instead shifted to issues like welfare schemes, government jobs, development, and civic infrastructure ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ and, evidently, the Congress.
Whether this perceived surge in peopleï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s interest in the Congress will translate into votes come November 30 remains to be seen. And Telangana Congress chief A Revanth Reddy, who is spearheading the partyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s campaign, is mindful of this, cautioning his party candidates not to get carried away by ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½hypeï¿½antage of the mood,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he told them at Nagarkurnool Tuesday.
Advertisement
Decoding Politics | Why sparks are flying in Telangana between BRS, Cong over free power
In Nalgonda district, the Congress hopes rest on the Komatireddy brothers, Venkat Reddy and Raj Gopal, with the party celebrating his return from the BJP. The two brothers, together with their immense financial muscle, have thrown in their weight behind all the party candidates in this region.
In the 2014 polls, in the undivided Nalgonda district with 12 Assembly seats, the BRS had won 6 seats as compared to the Congressï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s 5. In the 2018 polls, the BRS won 9 seats as against the Congressï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s 3, which included the Nakrekal, Huzurnagar, and Munugode seats. The Congress later lost the Huzurnagar and Munugode seats to the BRS in the bypolls.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Government schemes are here to stay, whatever be the party. The question is who will give more and from which par student, says at Nakrekal.
Advertisement
At Cheruvugattu in the area, Pravin Chari, a diploma civil engineer, who calls himself a BRS supporter, is also sceptical of the ruling partyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s chances. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Youth are a bit disappointed over lack of government jobs. I think that factor and the feeling that has settled among people that only pro-BRS beneficiaries have taken advantage, will result in tough contests all over Nalgonda,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he says.
At Deverkonda, former Communist Sarpanch M Ramesh Reddy says that the Komatireddy brothers are ensuring a ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½tough fightï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ between the BRS and Congress. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½If the BRS has to win, all the beneficiaries have to vote for it,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he says.
The contest between the parties has now started coalescing around the ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Indiramma rajyam (rule of ex-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½arided Mahbubnagar district with 14 seats, the BRS had won 7 seats as against the Congressï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s 5. In 2018, the BRS made a clean sweep in the region, bagging 13 seats while the Congress could get just 1 seat.
Congress stalwart Revanth Reddy is now contesting from the Kodangal seat here, while Jupally Krishna Rao, who quit the BRS to join the Congress, is another prominent contender from the district.
Advertisement
Nalgonda MP N Uttam Kumar Reddy and K Jana Reddy are also leading the partyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s campaign in the region.
The Congress attempt to match the BRS in promises notwithstanding, sitting BRS Nalgonda MLA K Bhupal Reddy says the KCR governmentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s scheme legacy will result in a third straight win. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½At least 70% of the beneficiaries will vote for the BRS,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ says Bhupal Reddy.
Advertisement
In Alair, Jadcherla and Shadnagar areas, many supporters of the late Y S Rajshekar Reddy, the Congress also seem to be disgruntled this time.
Some of them say they participated in Rahul Gandhiï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Bharat Jodo Yatra last year when it traversed the state.
Advertisement
Government jobs are a big issue among the youth here, says Narendra Goud, a Group 1 job aspirant. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½And they feel the BRS has let them down. A majority of them attended Group 1 and 2 coaching classes at Hyderabad, but returned home disappointed.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The BRS enjoys strong support from some BC (backward class) groups, especially occupation-based castes like Golla Kuruma to whom the BRS government has provided sheep in large numbers in Nalgonda and Mahbubnagar districts.
In Warangal district, it seems to be a tight contest between the BRS and Congress. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½People love KCR, but I guess that after nine years, there is anti-incumbency. It depends on whether BRS schemes stand it in good stead or not. Farmers who receive Rythu Bandhu without fail may stick to KCt K Maheshwar Reddy, a farmer from Parkal.

Title: Karnataka Congress govt may not bite the bullet as Dalit ministers raise internal quota demand
Text:
The Karnataka Congress government appears to have decided to put the ball in the Centreï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s court over the implementation of the 2012 report of the Justice A J Sadashiva Commission. Dalit leaders in the state Congress have been demanding that the government accept the report and provide ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½internal quotasï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ to Dalits.
The Commission had been set up by a Congress-Janata Dal (Secular) government in 2005, to look into the need for classifying Karnatakaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Scheduled Castes into sub categories for the purposes of reservations, and to find ways of doing it.
According to sources, the government has taken this position because the report had already been ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½partially acceptedï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ by the previous BJP government. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The Justice Sadashiva Commission report is not up for consideration. The previous government had accepted parts of it and had already writtnt
There is fresh urgency after November 11, when Prime Minister Narendra Modi told a poll rally in neighbouring Telangana that he would constitute a committee to look into the demand for internal reservations for Dalits, made by the Madiga Reservation Porata Samiti (MRPS) in that state.
Soon after, three Dalit Karnataka ministers ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Home Minister G Parameshwara, Social Welfare Minister H C Mahadevappa and Food and Civil Supplies Minister K H Muniyappa ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ along with seven-time Congress Lok Sabha MP K H Muniyappa, requested Chief Minister Siddaramaiah to accept the report.
In fact, Muniyappa, who belongs to the Madiga community ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ considered the most deprived among Dalits ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ has given a call to all Madigas to stage statewide protests demanding the implementation of the report. Two weeks ago, he had asked the community to stick to their demand for the implementation of the report in the state.
The Madigas are the quotas, and consider the Sadashiva report to be key to the delivery of social justice, because it studied the socio-economic conditions of Dalits as sub groups.
Advertisement
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½In our SC/ST convention before the state polls, we adopted a declaration, one of whose points was the promise to table the Sadashiva Commission report in the first Assembly session itself,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ said Home Minister G Parameshwara, who belongs to a smaller but better-off sub-group of Dalits called Holeyas.
Social Welfare Minister H C Mahadevappa, who is also a Holeya, however, believes the Sadashiva report needs to be considered, but only within the framework of the Constitution, and through consultations with the Law Department.
Law department officials, however, are of the view that the implementation of the report is now the prerogative of the Centre, since the previous outgoing BJP government had partially accepted it and recommended internal quotas through a Cabinet sub-committee that sSadashiva Commission report was accepted by the previous BJP government and placed before a Cabinet sub-committee headed by the then law minister. After the sub-committee modified the recommendations, they were accepted by the government,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ said sources in the state law department.
The Sadashiva Commission findings
Among the essential findings of the Sadashiva Commission, which were publicised through a press release in 2012, is that Madigas (SC Left), who are considered untouchable in the caste hierarchy, are more socially backward than the ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½SC Rightï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ groups like Holeyas, who are considered more acceptable in society.
The commission also found that most of the existing 15% quota for 101 Dalit sub-groups was being cornered by the SC Right groups like Holeyas and new SC groups like the Bhovis and the Lambanis, while the most backward Madigas continued to be deprived.
The report also indicated that while Holeyas and Madigas made up neaere about 2% higher than that of the Holeyas.
The BJP had promised to implement internal reservations before the 2018 Assembly polls. In power, however, the BJP government then led by CM Basavaraj Bommai rejected the Justice Sadashiva Commission report, but said it could implement some recommendations made by the Cabinet sub-committee set up to study the report. The government ended up allotting 6% quotas to the SC Left (including Madigas, as suggested by the report), 5.5% to the SC Right (Holeyas), 4.5% to the touchables (Bhovis and Lambanis), and 1% to other Dalits.
Advertisement
Before accepting the recommendations of the sub-committee, the Bommai government increased the overall quota for SCs in the state from 15% to 17%. Since this raised the combined SC-ST quota by 6% ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ taking total reservations in the state to 56% (OBCs 32%, SCs 17%, STs 7%), ie., above the 50% ceiling fixed by the SC in the 1992 Indira Sawhney judgment ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ the Bommai government asked tnth Schedule of the Constitution, to prevent these from being overturned by courts.
The poll boomerang
Eventually, the Karnataka BJPï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s move to hike the reservation quota of SCs and STs before the Assembly elections in May had not paid off. While the party failed to secure a single ST-reserved seat ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ it had won seven last time ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ its tally of SC-reserved seats dropped from 16 in 2018 to 12.
Advertisement
In contrast, the Congress won 21 of the 36 SC-reserved seats (up from 12 in 2018) and swept the ST seats b

Title: Decoding Politics: Why is BJP raising two ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½commentsï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Text:
Poll-bound Rajasthanï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s political discourse seems to be revolving around two key issues. Firstly, a comment by state Cabinet minister and Ashok Gehlot loyalist Shanti Dhariwal, which allegedly insulted the women of the state.
Another issue that has grabbed the limelight is an alleged remark by Chief Minister Gehlotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s son Vaibhav, that the Congress government led by his father will not come back to power.
So, how have the two issues become a frequent feature of the political discourse in Rajasthan?
Dhariwalï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s statement and the subsequent row
Advertisement
On March 9 last year, a day after International Womenï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Day, Dhariwal during an address in the Assembly said the high number of rapes in Rajasthan were due to it ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½being a menï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s stateï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½.
Replying during a debate on grants to the p s**** (Why we are number one in rapes, there is a fault somewhere).ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As a few MLAs behind him began speaking, Dhariwal turned around and said, ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Rajasthan toh mardon ka pradesh raha hai. Ab uska kya kare? (Rajasthan has been a state of men. What can be done?)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ The MLAs then burst into laughter.
However, no protests were held in the Assembly over the remarks as the Opposition BJP had staged a walkout before the ministerï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s address. However, later in the day, BJP state president Satish Poonia slammed Dhariwalï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s comments and termed his ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½shameless confession of the state being number one in rapesï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ an insult to the women.
Advertisement
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The remarks have also lowered the dignity of men. If the Congress has any morality left, such a minister should be sacked,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he had said.
The National C were the result of a ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½slip of tongueï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½.
Advertisement
The ministerï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s candidature for the polls hung in the balance with the Congress high command reportedly against it for his role in organising a separate meeting of MLAs loyal to Gehlot while skipping an official Congress Legislature Party (CLP) meeting last year. Eventually, he was fielded by the party from Kota North, which he represents in the current Assembly.
The BJP has now dug up the year-old issue to slam the Congress. At a rally in Bharatpur last week, Prime Minister Narendra Modi attacked Dhariwal without naming him.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The Congress has rewarded this minister with a ticket instead of punishing him. Even people in Delhi (Congress high command) agreed to give him a ticket. This raises a question of what ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½second red diaryï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ is in the possession of jaadugarï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s (Gehlot) favouritDelhi. After the BJP forms the government here, I promise to unravel that secret too,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Modi had said.
This brings us to the question of what the ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½first red diaryï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ is.
The first red diary and Vaibhavï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s statement
The ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½red diaryï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ first hogged the limelight in July after former minister of state Rajendra Singh Gudha claimed he was sent by the CM to retrieve the diary from the house of Gehlotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s close aide Dharmendra Rathore, whose house was being raided by central agencies amid a political crisis in 2020.
Advertisement
Gudhaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s claims came after he was sacked as minister by Gehlot, hours after he had slammed the state government in the House over the rise in crimes against women. The former MoS had urged his government to introspect on this, rather than speak on the violence in Manipur.
Since his unceremonious  had he not retrieved the diary.
Advertisement
Gudha has now joined the Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde) and will be in the fray from Udaipurwati constituency, which he won in 2018 as a BSP candidate.
Last week too, the Udaipurwati MLA raked up the issue when he showed some pages of the purported diary to the media. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Vaibhav Gehlot says this government will not come back to power. I can give it in writing that my father cannot come back to power. Rajendra Gudha is not saying this. Title: Today in Politics: PM Modi to chair virtual G20 summit; Amit Shah steps up Rajasthan campaign
Text:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will chair a virtual summit of G20 leaders on Wednesday evening, to discuss the implementation of the Delhi Declaration adopted in September and several new challenges that have emerged since then.
Addressing a press conference in Delhi on the eve of the summit, Indiaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant said the deliberations will witness ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½excellent participationï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ from leaders of the grouping.
Chinaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Xi Jinping and Russiaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Vladimir Putin had skipped the G20 Leadersï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Summit in New Delhi on September 9 and 10. However, the Russian Tass news agency, quoting a Kremlin statement, has confirmed that Putin will take part in the extraordinary virtual G20 summit on Wednesday, adding that the Russian President had to miss the Delhi summit in September and the Bali summit in November, 2022, as he had to focus on the ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½speth the world leaders for a second time during Indiaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s G20 Presidency before it passes on to Brazil in December.
The virtual meeting of G20 leaders is taking place a day after leaders of the BRICS grouping held an extraordinary meeting on the humanitarian crisis in Gaza.
On the domestic politics front, with just two days left for campaigning for the November 25 Rajasthan Assembly elections, Union Home Minister Amit Shah will continue his campaigning in the state on Wednesday, addressing rallies in Pali, Jalore and Sanchore districts.
The Rajasthan poll campaigning turned more bitter after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi Tuesday referred to PM Modi as a ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½panauti (harbinger of bad luck)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, linking his presence in the stadium to Indiaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s loss against Australia at the ICC World Cup finals in Ahmedabad on Sunday.
Advertisement
This came a week after Modi had called Rahul ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½moorkhon ka sardaarehe BJP reacted sharply, accusing Rahul of using abusive language against the Prime Minister because of the frustration of electoral losses. Read more in Vikas Pathakï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s report, here.
The Congress Tuesday announced its Rajasthan manifesto, promising a law to ensure MSP for crops, doubling the insurance sum under the flagship Chiranjeevi health insurance from Rs 25 lakh to Rs 50 lakh, 10 lakh jobs in the next five years, including 4 lakh government jobs, as well as CCTV cameras in public places for the safety of women.
Advertisement
The incumbent partyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s other promises include bringing the Vidhan Parishad to Rajasthan ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½for wider participationï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½stringent legal measures for hate speechï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, and constitution of ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½reconciliation and camaraderie committees at the district level to address hatred and enmity between communitiesï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½al (SAD), on the backburner, the BJP is banking on Central schemes targeted at the state to entice the rural poor, while attacking the ruling AAP for ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½hijackingï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ such schemes. Meanwhile, the Akalis are turning to the stateï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s youth, offering them pathways up the political ladder via their new membership drive. Read Navjeevan Gopalï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s report, here.
Announcing the Samajwadi Party (SP)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s programme to pay tributes to the partyï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s founder, late Mulayam Singh Yadav, on his birth anniversary Wednesday, SP national president Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that after the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, there will be a ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½big changeï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ in the country and samajwadis will play an important role in it.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½After 2024, there will be a different kind of a change in the country, and samajwadis will play an importandvertisement
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Seeing the strength of the PDA, many parties are now supporting caste census. Even parties which had earlier stopped this, have now come in favour of caste census,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he said.
The SP president said the caste census has been a longstanding demand for his party because it is crucial for social justice. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The first thing SP will do after coming to power is to conduct a caste census,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he added.

Prabhu is being cross-examined by lawyers of the Shiv Sena (Shinde) in the case related to the disqualification of MLAs of the undivided Shiv Sena.

On September 18, the Supreme Court had directed Maharashtra Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar to give the judgment on disqualification of rebel Sena MLAs by December 31, coming down hard on him over the delay in deciding the disqualification pleas filed by both Sena factions against each other.
In Kerala, the LDF governmentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s outreach programme, ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Nava Kerala Sadasï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, will continue through Kannur district on Wednesday, when CM Pinarayi Vijayan will chair a Cabinet meeting at Thalassery.
On Tuesday, Vijayan claimed the workers of the CPI(M) youth wing DYFI had saved the lives of some Youth Congress (YC) activd.
The Congress contested the CMï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s statement, claiming that the CPI(M) and DYFI workers had carried out brutal violence against Congress student wing Kerala Students Union (KSU) and YC activists.
Earlier in the day, Vijayan, at a press briefing in Kannur, had said he was sitting in the front seat of the bus on which he and his Cabinet colleagues were travelling as part of the sadas, and saw the YC activists trying to jump in front of the vehicle.

Title: Rajasthan polls | ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Will teach Congress a lessonï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½: The Sa
Text:
THE CONGRESS has survived a narrow win, one mutiny and one quieter rebellion in the last five years to stay in power in Rajasthan ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ all the while dogged by the Sachin Pilot question. Now, the BJP is cashing in.
In 2018, the Gujjar community had rallied behind Pilot, electing 8 Gujjar MLAs from the Congress and none from the BJP. The BJP and Congress are matched in tickets to Gujjar candidates this time ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ 10 and 11, respectively ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ and the BJP is banking on the community favouring it, especially in eastern Rajasthan, where Pilotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s influence goes well beyond the Gujjar community.
The BJP has been working on the plan for long. This January, Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a programme to commemorate the 1,111th ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Avataran Mahotsavï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ of Gujjar deity Devnarayan in Bhilwara.

The BJPï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s confidence is reflected on the ground. Sumer Singh Gurjar, 52, says: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½We voted for the Congress with tann, mann, dhan (wholeheartedly). Par daga kar diya Pilot ke saath (But they cheated Pilot).ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The support for Pilot had also carried several Scheduled Tribe and Scheduled Caste candidates of the Congress past the winning mark in 201mta Bhupesh (SC) and MLA O P Hudla (ST), among others.

The Gujjar-Meena bonhomie, or whatï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s left of it, was further strained by Parsadi Lalï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s remark recently, saying: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Sachin Pilot, Rajesh Pilot ko humne he panpaya hai (have thrived due to us). No one knew them before 1984. I was the lone Meena leader who was with them and supported whoever the party asked us to ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ be it Sachin, Rajesh or Rama Pilot.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In September, Congress MLA from Sawai Madhopur and Chief Minister Ashok Gehlotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s adviser Danish Abrar faced the brunt of the anger over the Pilot issue in his own constituency. Considered a Pilot loyalist, he had sided with Gehlot during Pilotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s 2020 rebellion, when the then deputy CM and 18 other MLAs had parked themselves in hotels in BJP-ruled Haryana, ultimately failing to get enough numbers to break away.
Visiting Sayed Pilot).ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The same month, a vehicle in which Niwai MLA Prashant Bairwa was travelling came under attack. Like Abrar, Bairwa too was considered close to Pilot but did not join him in the rebellion.
In Dausaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Kherli village, father-son duo Nihal Singh Gurjar and Ajay Singh, 26, say the Congress would have benefited had it implemented a formula of 2.5-years each for Gehlot and Pilot as CM. The high commandï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s efforts in this regard were constantly thwarted by Gehlot. Nihal says they wonï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t vote for Bhupesh this time even if Pilot himself canvasses for the minister. Tonkï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Muslim ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½angerï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In Tonk, Pilotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s own Assembly constituency ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ where they are the largest group among 2.5 lakh voters ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ the Muslims are also angry with the Congress government, their despair arising from its ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½silenceï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ on issues affecting the community. However, they are largely forgiving of Pilot.
This August, during a visit to Tonk, Pilot was accosted by Mohsin Rasheed, the Rajasthan coordinator of the Congress minority cell, who asked why he hadnï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t spoken up on the Nasir-Junaid case, referring to the killing of two Muion being that they were not innocent. Pilot admonished him for ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½spreading galatfehmi (falsehoods)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½.

When the elections came around, Rasheed, 42, who has a significant following on social media, threw his hat into the ring. He later withdrew, on the counsel of ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½the communityï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s eldersï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ and after assurances by the Pilot camp, he says.
Rasheed still talks about Pilotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s muted response on issues affecting the community, including a recent statement by BJP Tonk district in-charge and controversial leader Ramesh Bidhuri that ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Lahore is watching the Tonk pollsï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½.
However, out in the streets of Tonk, the general ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ and generous ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ view is that Pilot canï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t afford to take a pro-elplessness)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½.
Among a group at a tea-stall nearby, Arif, 45, says Muslims have no option other than the Congress. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Where else will we go?ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
After Muslims, the biggest chunk of voters in Tonk are SCs, followed by Gujjars, and then Jats, STs and upper castes. While Pilotï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s candidature makes it a safe seat for the Congress now, it has voted almost equally for the party and BJP since the BJP was formed in 1980 ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ with the BJP winning in 1980, 1990, 1993, 2003 and 2013; and the Congress in 1985, 1998, 2008 and 2018.
Last time, Pilot won by over 54,000 votes against the BJPï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Yunus Khan, an influential leader displaced from his traditional bastion.
While Pilot is expected to win again, if not as comfortably, even staunch Gujjar supporters believe the government may be changing in Jaipur. Title: Ex-CJ defends rap on EC: if itï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s seen tilting, i
Text:
Acknowledging the need for judicial restraint, Justice Sanjib Banerjee underlined that the Election Commissionï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s conduct can have ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½great consequencesï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ for democracy as he defended his 2021 observations, as former Chief Justice of the Madras High Court, that ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½murder chargesï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ should be imposed on the poll panel for violating Covid protocols during Tamil Nadu Assembly elections.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½A judge should certainly be restrained. However, the Election Commission is an institution which has a great responsibility. So, if it is seen tilting, one way or the other, by even a very small degree, it can have great consequences for democracy,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he told The Indian Express days after he retired as Chief Justice of Meghalaya High Court.
After an 11-month stint as Chief Justice of Madras High Court, Justice Banerjee was transferred as Chief Justice of the Meard (in Madras HC) for a while and I felt there were some aberrations which is why those observations were made. Crowding in rallies and not following Covid protocol was certainly a concern and when the elections in West Bengal was held an eight phases, why was it held in a single phase in Tamil Nadu? You have to look at it in that context and not pick just two sentences,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Justice Banerjee said.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Also, one cannot say that the court canï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t make any observations. Lawyers cannot be expected to argue with a wall. They have to get indications from the bench so they can tailor their case accordingly,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he said.
The EC had moved the Supreme Court against these observations, terming them ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½uncalled for, blatantly disparaging and derogatory.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
While the SC refused to expunge the observation or bar the media from reporting it, Justice Banerjeeï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Mew the reasons behind his unusual transfer, Justice Banerjee said that he is not concerned with the reason.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I am sure there were cogent reasons for my transfer but I am not aware of it. I received an email (from then CJI NV Ramanaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s office) and I said yes. Once you become a judge, you cannot have any ambitions of holding a particular office. So there was no question of me not consenting to the transfer,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he said.
A statement published by the Collegium on November 9, 2021 said that ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½the Supreme Court collegium in its meeting held on 16th September, 2021, has recommended the transfer of Mr Justice, Sanjiv, Banerji, Chief Justice, Madras High Court to Meghalaya High Court.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Advertisement
While the statement cited no reason, Justice Banerjee said that the email only indicated that the transfer would be in the ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½interest of better administration of justice.ï¿½M my 11 months in Madras, I had very rewarding judicial work. But in Meghalaya, there wasnï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t a lot of judicial work but we focused on infrastructure building.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
On his stint in Madras, Justice Banerjee said that he was far from wanting to maintain the status quo and actively handled things in Madras High Court.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½While the idea is that a Chief Justice who comes from outside takes a dispassionate view when it comes to appointments or other aspects, there is a flip side that they could end up being status quo-ists without wanting to ruffle too many feathers. By and large, the office of Chief Justice is considered a stepping stone for Supreme Court judgeship. It is to be somewhere but look elsewhere and not take steps to actively address the uncle judge syndrome when it comes to appointments,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he said.
As a High Court judge for nearly two decades, he said, corruption in the higher judiciary worries him.
Advertiseicult to gather evidence. These activities are not done in broad daylight but it is possible to collect some evidence of corruption. However, impeachment is a political solution. A compromised judge is convenient for all political parties. This is an aspect which erodes faith in the system and needs to be tackled,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Title: In last leg of polls, Rahul Gandhi calls PM Modi ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½panauti
Text:
The campaign during the ongoing Assembly elections turned more bitter with Congress leader Rahul Gandhi Tuesday referring to Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a panauti (harbinger of bad luck), linking his presence to Indiaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s loss against Australia at the World Cup finals in Ahmedabad two days ago.
The BJP reacted sharply, accusing Gandhi of using abusive language against the Prime Minister because of the frustration of electoral losses.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Panautiï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ panautiï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Achha bhalaa hamare ladke wahaan World Cup jeetne waale the, par panauti harwaa diya. TV waale ye nahin kahenge magar janta jaanti hai (Our boys were going to win the World Cup, but panauti got them defeated. TV channels will not say this but the public knows),ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Gandhi said at a public rally in Balotra, Rajasthan.
Rajasthan goes to polls on November 25.
Advertisement
Just a week ago, Modi had called Rahul moorkhon ka sardaar (leadesease of not acknowledging Indiaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s achievements,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Modi had said in Madhya Pradesh, and said India had taken rapid strides in mobile manufacturing.
Earlier this year, Rahul Gandhi was briefly disqualified as a Member of Parliament after a Surat court handed him a two-year sentence for his remark on the surname Modi. He was reinstated only after the Supreme Court stayed the sentence.
Demanding an apology from Gandhi for his latest remark, BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said, ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½What has happened to you, Rahul Gandhi? You are so troubled because of the frustration of losses that you are using abusive language against the Prime Minister of the country. Our Prime Minister loves our players and goes to boost their morale and to help them. The Bharatiya team is doing well in Asiads, Olympics and paralympics. Our players played very well. Itï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s all right ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ defeat and victory happen. Rahul Ganwever, defended Gandhiï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s jibe. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Rahul ji has said what many have been thinking since 2 days! The World Cup finals was a moment of pride for 140 crore Indians and we were all looking forward to this historic occasion, but they were desperate to hijack it for their political mileage. The BJP should be the last ones to talk about political correctness. These Godse bhakts, including PM Modi, who have regularly insulted Pandit Nehru, Indira Gandhi ji, Sonia ji and Rahul ji with the most vile abuses are finding it difficult to digest the hard truth,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Venugopal wrote on social media platform X.
So now Rahul refers to PM @narendramodi ji as ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Panautiï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Theres more than irony or hypocrisy at work here ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ that a 55yr old who has never worked a day in his life, whose family has exploited country liiggered a political controversy during the Karnataka Assembly elections earlier this year with his ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½venomous snakeï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ jibe at the Prime Minister. He had found himself at the centre of a similar controversy last year during the Gujarat Assembly elections. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½We see your (Modiï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s) face in corporation elections, MLA elections or MP elections, everywhereï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Do you have 100 heads like Ravan,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he said at a public meeting in Ahmedabad.
