Title: Vir Das on International Emmy win for Best Comedy: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I hope we
Text:
Heï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s still ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½just a guy on a stoolï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ for whom the audienceï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s laughter will always be more precious than accolades, says Vir Das, the first Indian comic to win an International Emmy Award.
Das won the award for his Netflix stand-up special Vir Das: Landing in the best comedy category at a ceremony in New York on Monday night. He tied with the much acclaimed British series Derry Girls for the coveted prize.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The job is to take the beautiful chosen people of the world and humanise them a little bit by making an idiot out of myselfï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ I hope we all just get sillier and continue to be fools,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ the actor-comic, who returned home on Wednesday, told PTI in a virtual interview.
Advertisement
The future of the Indian comedy scene is ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½tremendousï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, the 41-year-old said.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½isgnition laughter.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½In my speech, I made sure to thank the Indian people for their laughter. I said it was the soundtrack to my life,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he said.
Advertisement
Injecting a note of reality as he celebrates his first International Emmy trophy, Vir Das said it will get him ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½maybe 30 seconds extra applauseï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ when he walks out on the stage. After that, it will only be about the laughs.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I will have to make them (the audience) laugh. At the end of the day, they will be like, ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½We have paid for this, so make us laugh.'ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Das, who has often courted trouble over his quirky, observational performances and social media posts, is already readying for shows in Chandigarh and Bengaluru.
Advertisement
He was one of the three Indians to be nominated at the 51st International Emmy Awards along with Shefali Shah for Delhi Crime season two (Netflix) and J Instagram A post shared by Vir Das (@virdas)
The comic said there was ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½a bit of suspenseï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ at the awards gala when the winner for best comedy category was going to be announced because two envelopes made an appearance on the stage all of a sudden.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I tied with ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Derry Girlsï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, one of the best shows in the world,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he added.
That they were surprised to hear their name called out is generally a cliched response but the comedian said he only went to the International Emmy Awards with the intent to root for Shefali Shah, who was vying for a win in the best performance by an actress category. She was bested by Karla Souza of La Caida, a Mexican show.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I really considered my job to be there to root for Shefali. She is a once-in-a-generation talentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ I was just kind of focusing my energy on her. I was genuinely surpix show, itself is an achievement. So, when they said (the winner is) Vir Das: Landing, I was very, very surprised,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ he said.
Advertisement
Vir Das kind of fumbled his way up to the stage, but he got his thank yous right which was very important.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I said many things. The second I got off the stage, I panicked (wondering) did I thank everyone? I hope I didnï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t mess it up. (I said to myself) No, you thanked your wife, your family, Netflix and everybody who worked on it.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Advertisement
Vir Das: Landing is Dasï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ fourth special with Netflix. This was his second nod at the International Emmys; first one, also with the streamer, was for Vir Das: For India in 2021.
Through Vir Das: Landing, the aim was to tell the world what his ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½idea of homeï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ is, the comic said.
Advertisement
He was born in Dehradun and spent the first 14 years of his lifeýýý.
ýýýI get to travel the world. Itýýýs a tremendous privilege. What that comes with is I spend eight months a year missing home sometimes during a world tour. The germ of the show is from there. I miss home and a lot of times if Iýýým in New York or London, there are 3,000 people in the room, out of which 1,500 are Indians who havenýýýt been in a room with so many Indians in a really long time. You are their catch-up, their update with home. Thatýýýs what the central feeling of the show was. I donýýýt think there could be a better stage for the show to get some love than an international stage,ýýý he said.
His win comes almost a month after the sudden demise of popular American actor and comedian Matthew Perry. The late actor is best known for the popular 1990s sitcom Friends, in which he played the iconic role of socially awkward but amiable Chandler Bing who uses sarcasm to get by in life.
Das, who had shared a heartfelt tribute for Perry on social media after his passing, said the Friends star essayed his part like a lovable fool.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½The jesterï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s job, the jokerï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s job, the foolï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s job is to make fun of people to make them seem beautiful. Thatï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s what Matthew Perry did very well in a scene. He made the other person look good by being how silly he could be.ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Vir Das, also known for films such as Go Goa Gone, Delhi Belly, and Love Aaj Kal, has several acting projects lined up for 2024.
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½I just wrapped up a show which should be out soonï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ I co-directed a feature that goes on floor in February that Iï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ll star in. It will be my co-directorial debut of sorts. I should have an American piece of content out soon too. It (2024) is an acting year, a heavy acting year,ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï

Title: Shah Rukh Khan is IMDbï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s biggest Indian star of 2023 as Bollywood makes comeback with Alia Bhatt, Deepika Paduko
Text:
The Internet Movie Database (IMDb) on Wednesday announced its list of the most popular Indian stars of 2023, with Shah Rukh Khan taking the number one spot. The Badshaah of Bollywood has had a remarkable year, with two back-to-back blockbusters that broke numerous box office records. He first starred in Pathaan, and then in Jawan, which made a combined total of Rs 2200 crore globally. His third film of the year, Dunki, is lined up for release in December.

IMDbï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s top 10 list also included two of his Jawan co-stars: Vijay Sethupathi took the number 10 spot, while Nayanthara claimed the fifth position. Sethupathi had a busy 2023, appearing in the streaming series Farzi and five other films, including the critically acclaimed Viduthalai Part 1. Nayantharaï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s year, on the other hand, was dominated by Jawan.
